name: Fast zoom lens Photography
description: Apart from the fact that the distance between the action and the photographer constantly changes, venue lighting can also sometimes be very poor. As such, I always suggest the use of a fast zoom lens for the versatility and the ability to shoot in low light, while still retaining decent shutter speeds.

name: Interaction Moment Photography
description: Visuals of celebration, disappointment, and interactions are key moments in sport that often tell a story.When covering assignments make it a point to turn up for warm ups and stay till after the victory ceremony. That way you get to capture the expressions of people before, during and after the event.

name: Crop Sensor Light Photography
description: As a start, I would always recommend the 70-200mm f2.8. This lens is light, available across all major lens makers and is relatively inexpensive. An aperture of 2.8 is great for low light situations, and if you need the extra reach, you can just pop on a 1.4x teleconverter or just shoot with a crop sensor.

name: Long Shot or Wide Shot Photography
description: Olympic skateboarding will take two different disciplines in Tokyo and while they may look similar, they require two different sets of skills.

name: Point of View Shot Photography
description: Discover the history of Olympic swimming, from its early days as a military training technique to a showpiece Olympic event.

name: Medium Close Up Shot Photography
description: Shooting sports is a group of competitive and recreational sporting activities involving proficiency tests of accuracy, precision and speed in shooting
